1. Page Title: Dostoevsky's Near Execution

2. Panels:

   - Panel 1 — Setup: Dark square, soldiers, condemned men in white shirts  
     Dialogue/Thoughts:  
       • Dostoevsky: “Is this my last moment?”  
       • Grigoryev: “I can’t bear this!”  

   - Panel 2 — Setup: Tension, soldiers preparing to shoot  
     Dialogue/Thoughts:  
       • Dostoevsky: “I think of my brother…”  
       • Grigoryev: “No! Please, no!”  

   - Panel 3 — Setup: Soldiers suddenly stop, confusion in the air  
     Dialogue/Thoughts:  
       • Soldier: “Stand down! You’re spared!”  
       • Dostoevsky: “Alive… I’m alive!”  

3. Layout: vertical strip

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Dostoevsky's near-execution and subsequent imprisonment profoundly influenced his writing and views on suffering and cruelty.
